conclusion: The problem involves predicting which container (E, F, or G) liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from containers A, B, C, and D.
The setup shows colored liquids flowing from containers at the top (A, B, C, D) down through a series of baffles (colored rods) and ultimately reaching containers at the bottom (E, F, G).
The solution involves analyzing the liquid flow paths from each container (A, B, C, D) to determine the final destination.
Container A is represented by a green tab at the top, and there is a brown rod/baffle labeled A.
The green liquid from container A flows down and follows the brown rod.
The green liquid encounters the green path, which directs it further left.
The green liquid continues along the path and eventually reaches container E (brown container at bottom left).
Container B is represented by a pink tab at the top.
The pink liquid from container B flows straight down until it hits the purple rod.
The pink liquid flows along the purple rod toward the bottom left.
The pink liquid connects with the blue rod and flows leftward.
The pink liquid ultimately flows into container F (pink container at the bottom).
Container C is represented by a yellow tab at the top.
The yellow liquid from container C flows down and eventually makes contact with the orange rod.
The yellow liquid flows along a path that moves downward and to the right.
The yellow liquid flows into container F (pink container at the bottom).
Container D is represented by a blue tab at the top.
The blue liquid from container D flows down and contacts the orange rod.
The blue liquid follows a path rightward.
The blue liquid flows into container G (blue container at the bottom right).

Based on the visual evidence, liquid from container A flows into container E, liquid from container B flows into container F, liquid from container C flows into container F, and liquid from container D flows into container G.
